data.title: 2011 Census: Key Statistics and Quick Statistics for Wards and Output Areas in England and Wales
data.meta_description: This release follows that of the Key Statistics on 11 December 2012 and contains detailed geographical breakdowns and detailed Quick Statistics tables for residents' characteristics.
data.text:
2011 Census: QS101EW Residence type, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 256Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates of the number of usual residents living in households and in communal establishments, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts, and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS102EW Population density, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 196Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates of the population density for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS103EW Age by single year, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 1045Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates of the usual resident population by single year of age, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS104EW Sex, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 245Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by sex, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS105EW Schoolchildren and full-time students at their non term-time address, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 246Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify schoolchildren and full-time students at their non term-time address, by sex, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS106EW Second address, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 261Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by their use of a second address that is either within or outside of the UK, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS108EW Living arrangements, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 290Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 16 and over and living in households by their living arrangements, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). Living arrangements differ from marital and civil partnership status estimates because cohabiting takes priority over other categories.

2011 Census: QS110EW Adult lifestage (alternative adult definition), local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 427Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 16 and over in households, by adult lifestage, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). Adult lifestage classifies adults in households by age, the number of people in the household, and the presence of dependent children.

2011 Census: QS111EW Household lifestage, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 344Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by the household lifestage of the Household Reference Person, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). Household lifestage classifies households according to the age of the Household Reference Person , whether they are in a one or two person household, and for two person households, the presence of dependent children in the household.

2011 Census: QS112EW Household composition - People, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 460Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents living in households by the relationships between the household members (household composition), for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS113EW Household composition - Households, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 460Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by the relationships between the household members (household composition), for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS114EW Household composition (alternative child and adult definitions) - People, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 299Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents living in households by household composition (using the age of the household members, with no account of the relationships between them), for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The household composition classification used in this table uses the alternate definitions of an adult (any person aged 16 and over) and child (any person under the age of 16).

2011 Census: QS115EW Household composition (alternative child and adult definitions) - Households, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 301Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by household composition (using the age of the household members, with no account of the relationships between them), for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The household composition classification used in this table uses the alternate definitions of an adult (any person aged 16 and over) and child (any person under the age of 16).

2011 Census: QS116EW Household type, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 304Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households based on the type of family present, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS117EW People aged 18 to 64 living in a one adult household, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 248Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 18 to 64 by whether or not they live in a single adult household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS118EW Families with dependent children, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 292Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify families by the number of dependent children in the family, and by the age of the youngest dependent child, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS119EW Households by deprivation dimensions, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 249Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by four dimensions of deprivation

2011 Census: QS121EW Armed Forces, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 254Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify members of the armed forces as residents of households or communal establishments, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS204EW Main language (detailed), local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 1003Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates of the usual resident population aged 3 and over by their main language, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The Main language classification used in this table is a 103 category classification.

2011 Census: QS205EW Proficiency in English, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 245Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents aged 3 and over whose main language is not English, by how well they can speak English, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS210EW Religion (detailed), Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs) and Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) in England and Wales (ZIP 3725Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by religion, for regions, districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs) and Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The religion classification used in this table is a 58 category classification.

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by religion, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in London on census day (27 March 2011). The religion classification used in this table is a 58 category classification.

The religion classification used in this table is a 58 category classification.

2011 Census: QS210EW Religion (detailed), Output Areas (OAs) in the South East (ZIP 2519Kb)

The religion classification used in this table is a 58 category classification.

2011 Census: QS210EW Religion (detailed), Output Areas (OAs) in the South West (ZIP 1667Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by religion, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in the South West on census day (27 March 2011). The religion classification used in this table is a 58 category classification.

2011 Census: QS210EW Religion (detailed), Output Areas (OAs) in the West Midlands (ZIP 1703Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by religion, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in the West Midlands on census day (27 March 2011). The religion classification used in this table is a 58 category classification.

2011 Census: QS210EW Religion (detailed), Output Areas (OAs) in Wales (ZIP 874Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by religion, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The religion classification used in this table is a 58 category classification.

2011 Census: QS210EW Religion (detailed), Output Areas (OAs) in Yorkshire and the Humber (ZIP 1615Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by religion, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in Yorkshire and the Humber on census day (27 March 2011). The religion classification used in this table is a 58 category classification.

2011 Census: QS210EW Religion (detailed), wards in England and Wales (ZIP 979Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by religion, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts, unitary authorities and wards in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The religion classification used in this table is a 58 category classification.

2011 Census: QS211EW Ethnic group (detailed), local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 2009Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The ethnic group classification used in this table is a 250 category classification.

2011 Census: QS211EW Ethnic group (detailed), Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs) and Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) in England and Wales (ZIP 30133Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group, for regions, districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs) and Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The ethnic group classification used in this table is a 250 category classification. Please note that some users may experience slow download times when trying to open this file due to the size.

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in London on census day (27 March 2011). This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in the West Midlands on census day (27 March 2011). The ethnic group classification used in this table is a 250 category classification. Please note that some users may experience slow download times when trying to open this file due to the size.

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The ethnic group classification used in this table is a 250 category classification.

2011 Census: QS211EW Ethnic group (detailed), Output Areas (OAs) in Yorkshire and the Humber (ZIP 9361Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in Yorkshire and the Humber on census day (27 March 2011). The ethnic group classification used in this table is a 250 category classification.

2011 Census: QS211EW Ethnic group (detailed), wards in England and Wales (ZIP 7239Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts, unitary authorities and wards in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The ethnic group classification used in this table is a 250 category classification.

2011 Census: QS301EW Provision of unpaid care, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 309Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by the number of hours of unpaid care that they provide, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS302EW General health, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 319Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by their general health, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS303EW Long-term health problem or disability, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 300Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by the severity of any long-term health problem or disability they may have, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS401EW Accommodation type - People, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 296Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual residents of households by the accommodation type of the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS402EW Accommodation type - Households, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 297Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by the accommodation type, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS403EW Tenure - People, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 313Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents of households by the tenure of the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS404EW Tenure - Household Reference Person aged 65 and over , local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 260Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households where the Household Reference Person is aged 65 and over, by the tenure of the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS405EW Tenure - Households, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 314Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by tenure, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS406EW Household size, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 273Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households with at least one usual resident by the size of the household (the number of usual residents in the household), for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS407EW Number of rooms, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 281Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households with at least one usual resident by the number of rooms available for use by the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS408EW Occupancy rating (rooms), local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 247Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by their occupancy rating (based on the number of rooms available for use by the household), for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS409EW Persons per room (Households), local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 240Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by the number of persons per room available for use by the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS410EW Persons per room (People), local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 240Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents of households by the number of persons per room available for use by the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS411EW Number of bedrooms, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 255Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households with at least one usual resident by the number of bedrooms that are available for use by the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS412EW Occupancy rating (bedrooms), local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 252Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by their occupancy rating (based on the number of bedrooms available for use by the household), for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS413EW Persons per bedroom - Households, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 238Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households by the number of persons per bedroom that is available for use by the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS414EW Persons per bedroom - People, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 239Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents of households by the number of persons per bedroom available for use by the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS415EW Central heating, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 265Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify households with at least one usual resident by the type of central heating available to the household, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS417EW Household spaces, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 217Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify household spaces (the accommodation used by or available for use by a household) as those with at least one usual resident, and those without any usual residents, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS418EW Dwellings, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 218Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify dwellings as shared or unshared, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS419EW Position in communal establishment, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 261Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual residents of communal establishments by their position within the establishment, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS420EW Communal establishment management and type - Communal establishments, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 473Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify communal establishments by the type of establishment, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS421EW Communal establishment management and type - People, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 468Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population of communal establishments by the type of establishment, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS501EW Highest level of qualification, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 264Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 16 by their highest level of qualification, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS502EW Qualifications gained, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 317Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 16 and over by the qualification that they have attained, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS601EW Economic activity, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 339Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 16 to 74 by economic activity, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS602EW Economic activity of Household Reference Persons , local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 341Kb)

his table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify Household Reference Persons by economic activity, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS603EW Economic activity - Full-time students, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 237Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents aged 16 to 74 who are full-time students by economic activity, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS604EW Hours worked, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 259Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 16 to 74 and in employment the week before the census by the number of hours worked, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011).

2011 Census: QS605EW Industry, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 429Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 16 to 74 and in employment the week before the census by the industry in which they work, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The industry classification used in this table is a 27 category classification.

2011 Census: QS606EW Occupation (Minor Groups), local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 1245Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 16 to 74 and in employment the week before the census by occupation, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The occupation classification used in this table classifes the population at the minor group level using a 124 category classification.

2011 Census: QS607EW NS-SeC, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 643Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population aged 16 to 74 by the National Statistics Socio-Economic Classification (NS-SEC), for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). NS-SEC provides an indication of socio-economic position based on occupation. It is an Office for National Statistics standard classification. The NS-SEC classification used in this table is a 54 category classification.

2011 Census: QS608EW NS-SeC of Household Reference Person - People aged under 65, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 647Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents living in households who are aged under 65 by the National Statistics Socio-Economic Classification (NS-SEC) of their Household Reference Person, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). NS-SEC provides an indication of socio-economic position based on occupation. It is an Office for National Statistics standard classification. The NS-SEC classification used in this table is a 54 category classification.

2011 Census: QS609EW NS-SeC of Household Reference Person - People, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 647Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents living in households by the National Statistics Socio-Economic Classification (NS-SEC) of their Household Reference Person, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). NS-SEC provides an indication of socio-economic position based on occupation. It is an Office for National Statistics standard classification. The NS-SEC classification used in this table is a 54 category classification.

2011 Census: QS610EW NS-SeC of Household Reference Person (HRP) - HRP aged under 65, local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 647Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify usual residents living in households where the Household Reference Person is aged under 65, by the National Statistics Socio-Economic Classification (NS-SEC) of their Household Reference Person, for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). NS-SEC provides an indication of socio-economic position based on occupation. It is an Office for National Statistics standard classification. The NS-SEC classification used in this table is a 54 category classification.

2011 Census: Quick and Key Statistics: Table links to Neighbourhood Statistics (Excel sheet 145Kb)

Quick and Key Statistics: Table links to Neighbourhood Statistics

2011 Census: Table CT0010 Ethnic group (write-in responses), local authorities in England and Wales (Excel sheet 911Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group , for regions, counties, London boroughs, districts and unitary authorities in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The ethnic group classification used in this table is a 94 category classification that provides selected write-in responses to the census ethnic group question.

2011 Census: Table CT0010 Ethnic group (write-in responses), Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs) and Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) in England and Wales (ZIP 4987Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group, for regions, districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs) and Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) in England and Wales on census day (27 March 2011). The ethnic group classification used in this table is a 94 category classification that provides selected write-in responses to the census question ethnic group question.

2011 Census: Table CT0010 Ethnic group (write-in responses), Output Areas (OAs) in London (ZIP 3547Kb)

This table provides 2011 Census estimates that classify the usual resident population by ethnic group, for districts, unitary authorities, Middle Layer Super Output Areas (MSOAs), Lower Layer Super Output Areas (LSOAs) and Output Areas (OAs) in London on census day (27 March 2011).
